name: Feather Down Farms at Park Farm

reviews.text: A rather amazing place to stay. Our hen party of 23 took over the entire site for a long weekend and Park Farm were accommodating, helpful and understanding. The cabins themselves are rather beautiful and the pet goats went down a treat. I was in "the cupboard" and was surprised and delighted to find out that I really was sleeping in a cupboard. Very cosy although we were all cold on the first night. The temperature picked up after that.
reviews.title: Absolutely Stunning but at a Price!

reviews.text: It does take an hour to make a cup of tea/coffee as it is 45 minutes to get the wood burner up to temperature. It is then another 15 minutes at least to get the kettle to boil on the stove.
reviews.title: An incredible experience

aka: Feather Down Farms At Park Farm Faringdon, England - Oxfordshire
description: Park Farm is a mixed arable and sheep farm nestling on the edge of the picturesque village of Littleworth. Spectacular views stretch out from the foot of your tent away towards the Cotswolds and the Thames. At this point it is lined with weeping willows and lush pasture, a far cry from the brown muddy giant that cuts its way through London and its western suburbs, just an hour and a half’s drive away.
